climbs.name: Too Close for Comfort
climbs.fa: Alan Swanson and Kelly Rich, early 1990s

content.description: Hard crimping and smearing on a slab just left of an arete, sharing the same anchor as Conduct Unbecoming.
content.location: Climbs the left side of the arete on the right side of North Island. Another bolted line climbs the right side of this arete.

content.description: Good climbing via jamming and stemming up this clean cut corner on great rock. Shares an anchor with Something for Everyone.
content.location: Clean cut dihedral on the left side of the North Island, just right of Something for Everyone.

content.description: Climb the right side of the arete or on the arete via nice pockets and good rock past four bolts to the anchor, shared with Stem Christy.
content.location: On the left side of the North Island is an arete, essentially shared by this route and the route to the left, EZ Duz It. Something for Everyone climbs and/or uses the bolts on the right side of the arete.

climbs.name: Lack of Honor
climbs.fa: Malcolm Jolley, Gregg Davis & Bruce Lella 1990

content.description:
Steep sustained face & arete. Crux between 4th & 5th bolt

Awesome fun!
content.location:
To the right of, and the other side of the arete of

" Too close for comfort "

content.description:
Climb the left side of a sharp arete, occasionally stepping right to climb on the actual arete.

This is a decent first lead for the aspiring sport climber.
content.location: Just around the corner from Something for Everyone.

content.description: Start in the corner of the route, Conduct Unbecoming, before moving left and climbing the steep crack protected by bolts.
content.location: Starts in the middle of North Island, in the righthand of two corner cracks, Conduct Unbecoming.

content.description: Climb the clean cut crack in the corner to the old two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the righthand of two corner cracks at North Island.
